About Us

# Wausau Personal Injury Lawyer

Accidents happen all the time, and they are often outside of our control. If
an accident does cause a serious injury, state laws hold the guilty person
responsible for their careless behavior.

If you were involved in an unexpected accident and were seriously injured, you
deserve compensation to recover from your suffering. You have a limited time
to submit a claim, but a Wausau personal injury lawyer can outline your
options and help you seek justice.

Tell Us About Your Case

We Can Help

#### Get Help from an Experienced Personal Injury Attorney in Wausau, Stevens
Point, Marshfield, Antigo, and Minocqua, WI

When you’re injured in an accident due to someone else’s negligence, you need
an injury lawyer to represent your case and help you get the best
compensation. Bremer & Trollop Law Offices provides personal injury attorneys
in Wausau, Stevens Point, Marshfield, Antigo, and Minocqua, WI, to provide you
with the reliable representation necessary to help you get the best outcome.
Our auto accident lawyer will ensure you get maximum compensation for medical
bills, lost wages, and other unexpected expenses relating to your accident.

#### Representation for Many Types of Injury Cases

No matter what type of accident you were involved in, our accident injury
lawyers in Wausau, Stevens Point, Marshfield, Antigo, and Minocqua, WI, will
give you the guidance you deserve to get the best outcome. While we’re known
as an auto accident law firm, first and foremost, we can provide
representation for other personal injury cases. You can work with a:

  * Bicycle Accident Lawyer
  * Motorcycle Accident Lawyer
  * Car Accident Lawyer
  * Slip and Fall Lawyer
  * Wrongful Death Lawyer
  * Pedestrian Injury Lawyer
  * Truck Accident Lawyer
  * Product Liability Lawyer
  * Dog Bite Lawyer

When facing a vehicle accident claim or another personal injury case, you
don’t have to face it alone. Our personal injury attorneys are ready to
eliminate your stress and help you work toward the compensation you deserve
for your accident.

## When Can You Make a Personal Injury Claim?

Most accidents that injure people can be resolved through a personal injury
claim. Deciding whether filing a claim is worth your time depends on several
factors, including the severity of your injuries and the details of the
accident.

Personal injury claims are an option after many kinds of accidents, including
but not limited to:

  * Car, truck, or tractor crashes
  * Slips, trips, and falls in public places
  * Abuse in nursing homes
  * Injuries caused by defective products
  * Dog causing an injury or biting
  * Accidents in the workplace

A well-practiced lawyer in Wausau could help you determine whether a personal
injury claim is the best option for your unique situation.

Auto accidents can cause a number of serious injuries and property damage

Slip-and-fall accidents can be debilitating and impede your ability to work

a slip or trip was mostly the fault of the injured person and either deny the
claim or offer to pay only a small portion of the medical bills.

Injuries involving animal attacks can be substantial — a dog bite can lead to

READ MORE

you have to receive help with medical bills and other asbestos-related
expenses.

READ MORE

Product liability laws help protect consumers injured due to dangerous or
defective products such as toys, automobiles, lawn equipment or food.

READ MORE

Farm accidents can be grave or fatal, seriously affecting your livelihood.
Insurance companies devote considerable resources to fighting claims that can
result from farming accidents.

READ MORE

By law your employer must cover your medical expenses and lost wages resulting
from injuries received while on the job. But workers' compensation claims are
often fought by insurers.

Bremer & Trollop

Proving that Someone Else’s Carelessness Caused an Accident

Establishing that a defendant acted negligently is key to the success of your
personal injury case. From a legal standpoint, negligence refers to a failure
to exercise due care.

There are many situations where you might owe someone else a duty of care. For
example, if you are driving a car on a public road, you must watch out for
other motorists, pedestrians, or bicyclists.

To prove that someone else acted carelessly and caused your injury, you need
to demonstrate that:

  * The defendant had a duty to the plaintiff
  * The defendant breached the duty
  * The breach directly caused the accident that wounded the plaintiff
  * The plaintiff suffered an actual, documentable injury

A hardworking attorney in Wausau could strengthen your personal injury claim
by helping show that a defendant hurt you by failing to exercise due care.

## What Damages do People Collect in Personal Injury Cases?

Compensation in personal injury cases aims to award people money for the harm
they experienced due to a defendant’s carelessness. Common issues covered by
monetary damages include medical expenses, lost time at work, and appointments
with a doctor. Financial compensation could also provide payments for more
subjective factors like emotional distress, physical pain, scarring,
disability, or reduced enjoyment of daily life.

In some instances, you might also become entitled to collect punitive damages,
which are additional payments that intend to punish a defendant for extremely
reckless behavior. For instance, if a motorist drove their car while under the
influence of drugs or alcohol and hit you, punitive damages might apply.

Meanwhile, you might collect less compensation if you are partially
responsible for your own injuries. For instance, Wisconsin Statute §895.045
states that you need to pay damages equal to the level of blame you face for
an accident.

A diligent attorney in Wausau could help you determine the extent of financial
compensation you deserve in your personal injury case or fight against someone
who claims you are partially to blame.

## Contact a Wausau Personal Injury Attorney Today

If you are recovering from an injury, you need to focus on regaining your
health. You should not have to negotiate with stubborn insurance companies or
compromise with a defendant.

A Wausau personal injury lawyer could lessen the stress and complications
associated with collecting compensation, allowing you to recover fully. Call
today to learn more about your options.
